title: Raymond 2015 LVE Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a burly blend of 65% Petite Sirah and 35% Merlot. Brimming in jammy blackberry and black cherry, it has a touch of clove and cinnamon within its folds of soft plush fruit.

title: Roger Champault & Fils 2017 Les Pierris  (Sancerre)
description: From a densely planted vineyard, this soft wine has ripe pink-grapefruit and taut lime flavors, with a strongly mineral texture. It is very much up front, and needs time to settle. Drink from 2019.

title: Rubus 2015 Icono Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Baked berry and earthy plum aromas are dense and meaty. A raw, choppy palate shows aggression and tannic bite. Snappy black plum and wild berry flavors finish with inward pull along with lasting notes of mint and oak.

title: Salvano 2015  Barbaresco
description: Earthy aromas of tilled soil, game and a whiff of dark berry lead the nose. The straightforward palate presents raspberry jam, clove and white pepper alongside taut tannins that lead to a grippy finish. Drink after 2022.

title: Sarah's Vineyard 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Clara Valley)
description: From the estate's Dwarf Oak Vineyard, this bottling shows rounded red cherry, pomegranate, fruit punch and cinnamon stick on the nose. It's lean and racy with high acid on the palate, proving tart with a compelling texture although not much strong flavor on the palate.

title: Schlink Haus 2016 Made with Organic Grapes Riesling (Rheinhessen)
description: The nose suggests more earth and mineral than fruit but the palate here is fresh and fruity, boasting juicy tangerine and white grapefruit. Approachable and easy-drinking, it's an off-dry wine that finishes on a touch of spice and pepper.

title: Schloss Saarstein 2017 Auslese Grosse Lage Riesling (Mosel)
description: There's a dark, earthen tone that permeates throughout this deep gold Auslese. Dried apricot and yellow raisin flavors on the palate are delicately sweet and accented by savory notes of saffron and dusty minerality. Laser-like beams of acidity lend levity and grace to a moderately long finish.

title: Schlumberger Wein- und Sektkellerei 2016 Brut Klassik Grüner Veltliner (Österreichischer Sekt)
description: Slightly floral, slightly melony notes hail bright freshness from the first sniff. The rather frothy, fizzy palate is easy, light and mild, with a rather generous dosage that bolsters the easy stone fruit and lemon notes. The finish is dry and fresh.

title: Stolpman 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Ballard Canyon)
description: Fresh lime and wet stone meet with reductive grassy aromas and a touch of pear on the nose of this bottling. It's very tangy on the palate, showing citrus and apple cider elements.

title: Tenuta Carretta 2014 Garassino  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of dark berry, leather and underbrush emerge from the glass. The savory medium-bodied palate offers blackberry jam, star anise and black pepper alongside firm tannins. Drink 2020–2028.

title: Tenuta Rapitalà 2016 Classico Vigna Casalj Catarratto (Alcamo)
description: Aromas of mature orchard fruit, spring blossom and Mediterranean scrub lead the nose. On the tangy palate, a hint of bay leaf accents honeydew melon and citrus. A saline note signals the close.

title: The Originals 2017 Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of lime leaf, green flower and herb lead to just off-dry drinking white peach flavors. It brings textural heft and intrigue.

title: Theorize 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This white has a Muscat-like quality, a sweetness of peach, fig and apricot that's exotic and pronounced. Jasmine plays expertly on the nose.

title: Trivento 2016 Golden Reserve Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Pulpy aromas of blackberry, cassis, fig and pastry show a mineral streak. This feels solid and chewy, with spongy tannins. Standard black fruit flavors are normal for Mendoza Malbec, while this is weighty in feel and tastes of blackberry on the finish.

title: Trudon NV Roséphile Brut Pinot Meunier (Champagne)
description: Jérôme Trudon's crisp, red-currant-flavored rosé balances freshness with a bright character. Its fruit is still young and full of eager acidity. Another few months will make it even better. Drink from 2019.

title: V. Testulat NV Carte d'Or Brut  (Champagne)
description: Half Pinot Noir, half Pinot Meunier, this is in effect a Blanc de Noirs. It has intense acidity, with green-apple flavors and a tight, nervy texture that suggests the bottling is still young. To bring out more maturity, keep until mid-2019.

title: Vignobles Berthier 2017  Sancerre
description: This fruity wine is attractively textured and crisp, with a strong mineral edge that gives a bit of bite. Full of red-currant flavors and with final acidity, it will be better from 2019.

title: Villa Matilde 2014 Tenute di Altavilla  (Taurasi)
description: Forest floor, black-skinned berry and dark spice aromas slowly appear in the glass. On the tight, assertive palate, close-grained, drying tannins accompany blackberry extract, prune and licorice alongside firm acidity. It closes on a note of powdered sage.

title: Vinos de Arganza 2016 Encanto Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Ripe blackberry and cassis aromas are lusty and bring a note of oaky clove as this opens. A bold bright palate is juicy and rugged. Grapy black-fruit flavors are toasty, while the barrel influence is strongest on the finish, which tastes of clove, chocolate and oak spice.

title: Vollereaux NV Brut Réserve  (Champagne)
description: This nonvintage cuvée, a blend of equal parts of Chardonnay, Pinot Noir and Pinot Meunier, is ripe, soft and ready to drink. Creamed apples are balanced with acidity, a rounded texture and a warm aftertaste.
